Description: Painted terracotta shabti of a man named Bakkhons (also called Bakenkhons), with a black lappet-wig(worn), a yellow modelled face with a "goatee" beard, a black collar and crossed yellow hands holding red hoes; the leg section is inscribed with six rows of Hieroglyphic text; two yellow seed-baskets at the back.
Curator's comments: The collection contains two other shabtis of the same man (EA 71202 and 71203; on both he is only named Bakkhons).
